name: NPR
text:
Keeping students with the same teacher for another school year might help with essential relationship-building — and ease some of the difficulties created by online learning during a pandemic, experts say. (@MindShiftKQED)
https://t.co/8k64ouZkMl

name: NPR
text:
In Jerusalem's Old City, a wave of coronavirus cases has challenged devout communities to rethink how to pray safely.

Here are some of the ways Muslims, Jews and Christians are combining new practices with old customs.
https://t.co/P6QNB0kmrX

name: NPR
text: Blues guitarist Peter Green, a co-founder of the band Fleetwood Mac, has died at the age of 73. https://t.co/177rGhRrV7

name: NPR
text: On Sunday morning Lewis will cross the Edmund Pettus Bridge one last time. https://t.co/15IbMzqOXR

name: NPR
text: Hogan said cancer "perhaps made me more intensely focused on trying to protect the health of everybody," now that Maryland is threatened by the coronavirus. https://t.co/OFj6hOw0fN

name: NPR
text:
i don't know who needs to hear this but please stop overwatering your plant
 https://t.co/7o1qZxHfx8

name: NPR
text:
In his new memoir, cartoonist Adrian Tomine doesn't focus on his successes — but examines the trajectory of his life through embarrassing moments and setbacks.

The book is mesmerizing, funny and deeply honest, our critic writes.
https://t.co/ZfkVslXzOm

name: NPR
text:
The traditional music community is having its own reckoning with racism — deciding what to do about songs still sung today that were performed at minstrel shows, or whose lyrics contain racist slurs and stereotypes.
https://t.co/8bR7FOCFzB

name: NPR
text:
Actor Rosamund Pike plays Nobel Prize-winning scientist Marie Curie in the new biopic, "Radioactive."

Ahead of time, Pike started taking chemistry lessons — and says it was refreshing to prepare for a role by getting "mentally fit."
https://t.co/T72lnZ5wnO

name: NPR
text:
The winners of the 13th annual iPhone Photography awards, for best photos taken on an iPhone or iPad, were announced this week.

The photos capture moments of human joy, solitude and serenity — from Spain to India to China.
https://t.co/g4I3MwxuSF

name: NPR
text:
If you're looking for something to listen to this weekend, here are some of the best sets to come out of the modern era of the Newport Jazz Festival — featuring Herbie Hancock, Roy Hargrove, Cécile McLorin Salvant and more.
https://t.co/7MjPqH9G6o

name: NPR
text:
Women rarely received credit for their creative work in Colonial America.

But with a new album, one scholar is reviving the works of the women who lived and composed at the Ephrata Cloister commune. 
https://t.co/oBQeKla9Av

name: NPR
text: "Folklore," the surprise album from Taylor Swift, tops our list of the week's best releases — along with new ones from Lupe Fiasco, a 50th anniversary edition of Roberta Flack's debut album, and more. https://t.co/JsjWmhF9ZQ
